title: Ian Maxwell (footballer)
text:
Ian Gardner Maxwell (born 2 May 1975) is a <a href="Scottish%20people">Scottish</a> <a href="association%20football">football</a> executive and former player who is currently the Chief Executive of the <a href="Scottish%20Football%20Association">Scottish Football Association</a>.
Playing career.
Born in <a href="Glasgow">Glasgow</a>, Maxwell started his career with <a href="Queen%27s%20Park%20F.C.">Queen's Park</a> and played at <a href="Hampden%20Park">Hampden Park</a> for five years before moving to <a href="Ross%20County%20F.C.">Ross County</a> in 1998. He was part of the "Staggies" team that won the <a href="1998%E2%80%9399%20Scottish%20Third%20Division">1998–99 Scottish Third Division</a> and then finished third in the <a href="1999%E2%80%932000%20Scottish%20Second%20Division">1999–2000 Scottish Second Division</a> to secure a second consecutive promotion. He signed for <a href="St%20Johnstone%20F.C.">St Johnstone</a> in 2002, playing in the <a href="Scottish%20Football%20League%20First%20Division">Scottish First Division</a> for three more seasons before signing for First Division rivals <a href="St%20Mirren%20F.C.">St Mirren</a> in 2005.
Maxwell played in defence and was part of the St Mirren side which won the Scottish First Division title in the <a href="2005%E2%80%9306%20in%20Scottish%20football">2005–06 season</a>. In May 2008, having played in 33 <a href="Scottish%20Premier%20League">Scottish Premier League</a> games across two seasons, he moved back to the First Division with <a href="Partick%20Thistle%20F.C.">Partick Thistle</a> but was released at the end of the 2009–10 season.
Administrative career.
A few weeks later he was back at Thistle, as assistant manager to <a href="Ian%20McCall%20%28footballer%29">Ian McCall</a>. After McCall stepped down as Thistle manager in April 2011, <a href="Jackie%20McNamara">Jackie McNamara</a> and <a href="Simon%20Donnelly">Simon Donnelly</a> took control of the team, while Maxwell became the general manager. He was promoted to the position of managing director in 2014.
In April 2018, the <a href="Scottish%20Football%20Association">Scottish Football Association</a> announced that Maxwell would be appointed as their chief executive at the end of the <a href="2017%E2%80%9318%20in%20Scottish%20football">2017–18</a> season.
